DataElement.preferredName: Association Class Unified Modeling Language Metadata Source Role Entity java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: In UML modeling, an association that is also a class.  It not only connects a set of classes, but also defines a set of features that belong to the relationship itself.:A non-proprietary, third generation modelling language. The Unified Modeling Language is an open method used to specify, visualise, construct and document the artifacts of an object-oriented software-intensive system under development. The UML represents:Data about data; information that describes another set of data._Where something is available or from where it originates.:A Role is a non-hierarchical, named relationship between concepts.  They are binary relationships pointing from one concept to another concept.  Roles are unidirectional and each role has a Domain and a Range; the role points from one kind, the domain, to another (or same) kind, the range.  The specific concept pointed to is considered the Role Value._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

Concepts.definition: In UML modeling, an association that is also a class.  It not only connects a set of classes, but also defines a set of features that belong to the relationship itself.

A non-proprietary, third generation modelling language. The Unified Modeling Language is an open method used to specify, visualise, construct and document the artifacts of an object-oriented software-intensive system under development. The UML represents a compilation of "best engineering practices" which have proven successful in modelling large, complex systems.
Data about data; information that describes another set of data.

Property.preferredDefinition: Where something is available or from where it originates.:A Role is a non-hierarchical, named relationship between concepts.  They are binary relationships pointing from one concept to another concept.  Roles are unidirectional and each role has a Domain and a Range; the role points from one kind, the domain, to another (or same) kind, the range.  The specific concept pointed to is considered the Role Value.

Concepts.definition: Where something is available or from where it originates.

A non-hierarchical, named relationship between concepts.  They are binary relationships pointing from one concept to another concept.  Roles are unidirectional and each role has a Domain and a Range; the role points from one kind, the domain, to another (or same) kind, the range.  The specific concept pointed to is considered the Role Value.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
